channel.title: Client Hacking Beginner
channel.description:
Hey guys, I'm new here and I come to learn from you people the most I can. I'm a complete beginner in the subject of hacking, so even though i've been reading several threads over here, I still have several doubts that need to be cleared. From what I read, I managed to get a basic idea of how BCEL and the bytecode system work.
Now my questions are the following.
In the BCEL tutorials what is being modified is the Class file, how do I get RS's ones and how do I recompile them if they must be hosted in their servers?
In the tutorials, searches were done based on information they already knew about the source code, how am I supposed to know the name of the RS client's method where you (for example) load the map's items?
That will be it by now, if I happen to remember another one i'll post it.
Thanks beforehand!

Thanks the bank, im already in it.

item.title: Client Hacking Beginner
item.dc:creator: @ShKz ShKz
item.description:
@ShKz wrote:

By swing you mean the API used to create the gui? So it would be the loader, am I right?

Edit: I’ve gone through all the Runescape2 developmente section and have been able to clear lots of things out, and my final conclusion is that I should first get to know the RS2 client.

This brings the obvious, should I decompile it? look for an old deob version?

Read full topic

item.title: Client Hacking Beginner
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“ShKz, post:13, topic:373485”]Virtual machine or loader?[/quote]Bots such as RSBot just loads the applet into a SWING frame (the loaded classfiles are modified prior to bot execution in this case by a different application).

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @ShKz ShKz
item.description:
@ShKz wrote:

Virtual machine or loader?

Read full topic

bots generally load runescape into their vm

item.title: Client Hacking Beginner
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“ShKz, post:9, topic:373485”]That’s sweet…

Now, I’ve got another question, I’ve developed (in java obviously) a dummy application which asks for a user and password in order to begin editing bytecode, and I can’t seem too find where does the JVM extract the .class files on runtime in order to edit them. Am I supposed to extract, modify and compress them?[/quote]

You are supposed to extract and modify the class files, you can pack them back up in a jar to run them later, or not.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @ShKz ShKz

item.title: Client Hacking Beginner
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“ShKz, post:5, topic:373485”]Getting the jar is as easy as that? wow, and how about extracting the classes? or where do they appear on runtime?

Thanks Speljohan for the answer![/quote]You can do that with any world, as well as do whatever you wish for jar-name, as it uses a wildcard. So if i wanted to do say: http://world2.runescape.com/runescapeisformorons.jar that’d work fine.

Read full topic

item.title: Client Hacking Beginner

item.description:
@ShKz wrote:

Wow, I feel so dumb lol
You’re amazing, that’ll help by now, Thanks again!

Read full topic

item.title: Client Hacking Beginner
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“ShKz, post:5, topic:373485”]Getting the jar is as easy as that? wow, and how about extracting the classes? or where do they appear on runtime?

Thanks Speljohan for the answer![/quote]

A jar is just a zip file, so you can just use whatever you use on zips on it, even rename it to zip if you want.

Read full topic

item.title: Client Hacking Beginner
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

ShKz:

In the BCEL tutorials what is being modified is the Class file, how do I get RS’s ones

They are downloaded whenever you play the game.

ShKz:

and how do I recompile them if they must be hosted in their servers?

The client doesn’t run from their server, obviously. It runs from your PC. That said, if you’re using BCEL you probably aren’t decompiling at all, so there’s no need to recompile - you’re editing bytecode, remember?

ShKz:

In the tutorials, searches were done based on information they already knew about the source code, how am I supposed to know the name of the RS client’s method where you (for example) load the map’s items?

Well that’s the million dorrar question, isn’t it. You reverse it. Be that decompiling & deobfuscating as best you can to figure out the mess, looking at bytecode or live debugging.

First: learn Java, and write a few non-cheat related things.

Read full topic
